IvSJ4bbuiqMEyh3y9ghe9g.text: In mood of pho, so ordered a Bun Bo Hue, and a Egg Coffee. The broth is surprisingly sweet instead of a savoury taste as I expected. But I would say the beef is well cooked and tasty. Also enjoyed sprinkling chopped peanuts and chillies in it, as they added different textures to the soup. Egg coffee didn't taste so different from coffee with condensed milk which I had in other Vietnamese restaurants. Only when drinking the last bit of coffee, I felt somewhat the texture of egg. All in all, it was good and personally I think I would visit this restaurant again.

photos.caption: Photo of Saboteur - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hX08YjblQCdPYXbHso8yNg.text: While I'm really happy to see this kind of southeast asian food opening near campus, the flavor of the food seems inauthentic and somewhat lacking.   While I have had pho from Saigon to Hanoi, and am a therefore a little hard to please, I'm more comparing this to other asian food I've had in the UK and US. Even by those standards it is pretty weak. I ordered the Bun Bo Hue - a fabulously rich and spicy beef soup from Hue in central Vietnam. The noodles were tough and bland, and the soup, while well spiced, seemed to lack the depth of flavor that I've come to expect from Pho.   Would maybe go again to try the bahn mi or other options.

photos.caption: Photo of Saboteur - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. My disappointing Bun Bo Hue soup.

PtPYY_8P_zh2lQzhjqFDNQ.text: The atmosphere is very modern and hipster, but the pho was quite underwhelming.   I ordered the Bun Bo Hue, but the taste was as far from traditional pho as you can get. So, if you want VERY 'fusioned' pho, this can be a place to try, but not if you are expected traditional pho. Bun Bo Hue is suppose to be a beef and rice noodle soup dish with shimmered beef shank, lemongrass, shrimp paste, and spicy chili oil. However, the dish was lacking in the spicy department. The beef was quite dry. The soup was overly sweet, and the traditional ingredients aren't used here.   The service was also overall a meh. We seated quite literally in front of the open door so it was really drafty. We had to ask a couple times to even get a menu and utensils.

photos.caption: Photo of Saboteur - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bun Bo Hue

Fp15gjPcrPmhbYDL8fChTQ.text: Summary: A chic and well designed "pho" place that offers mixed feelings  If you want traditional Vietnamese Pho, this isn't the place for you. The flavor is drastically off and the ingredients used to make their pho are totally different. However, IF you are into a fusion form of Pho, take a chance and try this place out.   I, clearly, wasn't a fan of the pho here. The noodles had this weird earthy taste while the broth lacked the flavor of beef. The broth was on the sweet side and clearly made to suit western tastes. Coming from Los Angeles, I was really surprised how the dish I had was called pho. However, the ONE thing I did like about the pho was that the beef they used was high quality and tasted amazing.  The beef was juicy and tender, as if it would melt in your mouth!  Service is dodgy. The servers here offer you service based on what you look like and how you dress. When my friend tried to order her dish while I was in the restroom, the waiter apparently told her "Not now I'm busy". However, when I called him over after returning from the restroom, it seemed as if the gold chain on my neck turned me into a "vip" client. He quickly took my order and apologized to my friend for his error. My personal experience with the service is good, but others might have it differently.   On a side note, it seems like my friends really like their stir fried rice noodles. I have yet to try that--but from what I heard they are DELICIOUS.

photos.caption: Photo of Saboteur - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beef Pho
Photo of Saboteur - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Logo
Photo of Saboteur - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Well designed washroom

FWVu_jnvft-etk1OYpdohg.text: The food was so good, so so good. I sat and stared at the menu for a crazy long time because I wanted to eat everything. I finally settled on one of the chicken rice bowls and was impressed by the strong lemongrass flavor. Everything else was delicious and I wish I lived in Edinburgh just so I could go here (and to Mary's Milk Bar) every day.

vC9XOToDYjzfY_HJrkEJjw.text: We got the chicken pho and seafood pho and the flavor was top notch. The soup base had a slightly sweet hint to it and it made it really interesting and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Saboteur - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Saboteur - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Tbq89NfcL2tT-43AJHcxDA.text: this is the second worst nodules I never had before. I have traveled many countries and PHO is always one of my favour food. the waiter put us in a very small corner while there is other aviliable table. I asked why and he told me that table is for 4 people(we are three). and then he moved three white guy over there. no service at all.

YdRWqTLEhLI1b141_CUl_A.text: This is great and inexpensive Vietnamese food. I absolutely love the yellow curry (had it with Jasmine rice). Also had the fried rice with anise flavour -- can't remember what the dish is called. This was very good I've had it twice now. Everything is very clean and service is prompt. My only complaint is that the Chicken Pho is a bit bland. I would recommend the curries before the pho if you want lots of flavour.
